CONJUGATES: fluff (noun) | fluffs (plural noun) | fluff (verb) | fluffs (3rd person singular present) | fluffed (past tense, past participle) | fluffing (present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: Probably of imitative origin; related to dialectal German fluff 'light down, nap', or from flounce. First attested in English in the late 17th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Soft, light material, especially fine fibers or down, that comes off textiles, animals, or plants.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 柔软、轻盈的物质，尤指从纺织品、动物或植物上脱落的细小纤维或绒毛。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There was a lot of dust and fluff under the bed.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 床底下有很多灰尘和绒毛。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Something trivial, insubstantial, or of little value or importance.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 无足轻重、空洞或不重要的事情或内容；花边新闻。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The article was mostly just political fluff, with no real substance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这篇文章大部分只是政治花边新闻，没有实质内容。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To shake or pat something to make it look fuller and softer.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 抖松或拍松（某物），使其变得更蓬松柔软。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She fluffed up the pillows on the sofa before her guests arrived.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 客人们来之前，她把沙发上的枕头拍松了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make a mistake, especially in a performance, or to forget one's lines.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 犯错误，尤指在表演中出错或忘记台词。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The actor fluffed his lines during the dress rehearsal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位演员在彩排时忘词了。

REGISTER: Commonly used in everyday conversation and writing, across various contexts from informal to semi-formal.
